Chemical InhibJfion of Viruses 165 

not result from the infection, but also active immunity 
 against a second infection may develop. 

References 

1. Ackermann, W. W. The relation of the Krebs q^cle to viral 
 synthesis: II. The effect of sodium fluoracetate on the propaga- 
 tion of influenza virus in mice. /. Exptl. Med., 93:635-642, 1951. 

2. Ackermann, W. W. The role of a-methionine in virus propaga- 
 tion. /. Exptl. Med., 93:337-343, 1951. 

3. Ackermann, W. W., and Johnson, R. B. Some energy relations in 
 a host-virus system. /. Exptl. Med., 97:315-322, 1953. 

4. Ackermann, W. W., and Maassab, H. F. Growth characteristics of 
 influenza virus: the influence of a sulfonic acid. /. Exptl. Med., 
 99:105-117, 1954. 

5. Bozeman, F. M., Wisseman, C. L., Jr., Hopps, H. E., and Danaus- 
 kas, J. X. Action of chloramphenical on T-1 bacteriophage: I. 
 Inhibition of intracellular multiplication. /. Bact., 67:530-536, 
 1954. 

6. Brown, G. C., and Ackermann, W. W. Effect of DL-ethionine on 
 poliomyelitis virus growth in tissue culture. Proc. Soc. Exptl. Biol. 
 Med., 77:S67-Se9, 1951. 

7. Cairns, H. J. F. Quantitative aspects of influenza virus multi- 
 plication: III. Average liberation time. /. Immunol., 69:168-173, 
 1952. 

8. Cohen, S. S., and Anderson, T. F. Chemical studies on host-virus 
 interactions: 11. The chemical simulation of the interference 
 phenomenon by 5-methyl tryptophane. /. Exptl. Med., 84:525- 
 533, 1946. 

9. Cohen, S. S., and Arbogast, R. Chemical studies in host-virus in- 
 teractions: VI. Immunochemical studies on the purity of con- 
 centrates of various bacterial viruses prepared by differential 
 centrifugation procedures, with an appendix summarizing data 
 on the desoxyribonucleic acid content of these viruses. /. Exptl. 
 Mdd^., 91:607-618, 1950. 

10. Cohen, S. S., and Fowler, C. B. Chemical studies on host-virus 
 interactions: III. Tryptophane requirements in the stages of virus 
 multiplication in the Escherichia coli-T2 bacteriophage system. 
 /. Exptl. Med., 85:771-784, 1947. 

11. Curnen, E. C, and Horsfall, F. L., Jr. Properties of pneumonia 
 virus of mice (PVM) in relation to its state. /. Exptl. Med., 85: 
 39-53, 1947.
